author: Courtney Subramanian, Erik Wasson
description: Republican Senator Lindsey Graham said President Donald Trump had “greenlit” a bipartisan Russia sanctions bill with the GOP lawmaker expressing hope for a vote on the measure as soon as next week.
title: Graham Says Trump Gave Green Light for Russia Sanctions Bill

author: Magdalena Del Valle, John Harney
description: President Donald Trump has ordered the US government to pull out of 66 international organizations that the White House said “no longer serve American interests.”
title: Trump Withdraws US From 31 Bodies in UN, Already in Fiscal Peril

description: Ben Carson, White House Nutrition Advisor and former US Secretary of Housing & Urban Development, discusses President Trump's decision to take steps to ban institutional investors from buying single family homes. Carson talks about if this decision will bring down the cost of housing and if Trump is targeting big business. He also shares his thoughts on the new food pyramid that flips upside down to promote protein. Ben Carson speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Ben Carson on Trump's New Housing Plan, New Food Pyramid

author: Cailley LaPara
description: The US Department of Transportation is withholding about $160 million from California after the state delayed canceling thousands of commercial driver’s licenses that regulators say were issued illegally.
title: California Loses $160 Million in Federal Funds Over Trucker Licenses

author: Carmen Reinicke, Natalia Kniazhevich
description: With a series of incendiary posts on his social-media platform, President Donald Trump shook up the stock market on Wednesday by announcing potentially game-changing new policies targeting the housing and defense industries.
title: Stock Traders Whipsawed as Trump Sets Sights on Defense, Housing

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand is gearing up for a general election Feb. 8, which could usher in the fourth prime minister in three years. The snap vote is expected to produce a coalition government, heightening the risk of continued political instability.
title: Top Contenders Emerge as Thailand Heads to Polls Next Month

description: Senator Jeanne Shaheen (D-NH) states there are a lot of unanswered questions when discussing what’s next for the United States & Venezuelan oil. She also shares her reaction to the Trump Administration’s idea that the US will buy Greenland and what she expects from the House vote on the ACA tax extensions tomorrow. Senator Shaheen speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg’s “Balance of Power.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Acquiring Greenland is a 'Crazy Notion:' Sen. Shaheen

author: Patrick Clark
description: The time of the corporate landlord as America’s housing villain was supposed to be over.
title: Trump’s Bid to Block Corporate Homebuying Blindsides Wall Street

description: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer fatally shot a woman during a confrontation in Minneapolis, sparking an uproar over the presence of ICE agents in the city and heightening political divisions around the Trump administration’s migrant crackdown. The Wednesday shooting happened during what federal officials described as a targeted operation amid a broader immigration effort. The woman, described as White and middle-aged, was sitting in her car blocking a residential street because of the presence of federal agents, said Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O’Hara. There was no indication she had been a target of law enforcement, he said. President Donald Trump said the ICE officer appeared to be acting in self defense, calling video of the incident a “horrible thing to watch.” Bloomberg News Senior Reporter Myles Miller joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: ICE Agent Kills Woman in Minnesota, Fueling Anger Over Crackdown

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The US Senate is scheduled to hold a key procedural vote Thursday on a resolution blocking further military action against Venezuela, setting up the first test of congressional backing for President Donald Trump’s intervention in the South American nation.
title: Senate Sets War Powers Vote on Ending Venezuela Intervention

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: Swing-district Republicans defied party leaders to join Democrats in advancing legislation to revive expired Obamacare subsidies for three years, an indication of the political risks facing the GOP majority in the US House heading into this year’s midterm elections.
title: House Backs Renewing Health Subsidies, Defying Republican Leaders

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US government officials are in discussions with Chevron Corp. over potentially extending the crude producer’s special license to operate in Venezuela, as President Donald Trump seeks to enlist US companies in rebuilding the country’s decaying oil sector.
title: Chevron in Talks With US to Extend Venezuela Oil License

author: Maya Averbuch, Siddharth Philip
description: Avelo Inc., the Houston-based carrier that faced protests over conducting immigrant deportation flights, will cease those operations as part of a wider realignment that will also entail the closure of some of its bases.
title: Avelo to End Deportation Flights and Close Arizona Base

author: Edward Ludlow, Caroline Hyde
description: Anduril Industries Inc. founder Palmer Luckey said he didn’t oppose regulations on defense companies proposed by President Donald Trump, including limits on compensation.
title: Anduril Founder Says He Doesn't Oppose Defense Pay Caps

description: Anduril Industries Inc. founder Palmer Luckey says he pays himself $100,000 a year and supports President Donald Trump's plan to limit pay for defense contractor leaders. He also talks about expanding the business, China's ability to build drones, and building a new kind of TV. He speaks to Bloomberg at CES. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Anduril's Luckey Says He Pays Himself $100,000 a Year

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said Venezuela would be “purchasing ONLY American Made Products” with revenue from a deal that will see the country relinquish as much as 50 million barrels of oil to the US.
title: Trump Says Venezuela to Purchase US Goods With Oil Deal Revenue

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order pressing defense contractors to spend less on stock buybacks and dividends while boosting investment in infrastructure and weapons production, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Signs Order Pressing Defense Firms to Cut Buybacks

author: Olga Kharif
description: World Liberty Financial, the crypto venture co-founded by President Donald Trump, has filed an application for a US bank charter, the company said in a statement.
title: Trump Crypto Venture World Liberty Applies for Bank Charter

author: Zoe Tillman, Jeannette Neumann, Laura Curtis
description: Companies are flocking to challenge the administration's import taxes in court, after the Supreme Court started asking tough questions
title: More Than 1,000 Companies Are Suing Trump Over His Tariffs

author: Nick Wadhams
description: President Donald Trump demanded the US boost annual defense spending by more than 50% to $1.5 trillion for 2027, an unprecedented jump that he said would be paid for by revenue brought in by the tariffs imposed over the last year.
title: Trump Seeks 50% Boost in Annual Defense Budget to $1.5 Trillion

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: Republican House Speaker Mike Johnson invited President Donald Trump to deliver the State of the Union address on February 24, an opportunity to showcase the party’s agenda ahead of crucial midterm elections this year.
title: Trump Invited to Deliver State of the Union Address on Feb. 24

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: With Maduro in jail, the Danish territory is in the president’s sights.
title: Trump Turns His Attention From Venezuela Back to Greenland

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss the status of US-Venezuela as the White House and Energy Secretary Chris Wright say the US will control Venezuelan oil exports indefinitely. Bloomberg's Joe Deaux and University of Denver for Economic & Policy Research Senior Fellow Francisco Rodriguez join to discuss. Also, Walmart EVP of AI Acceleration Daniel Danker joins Bloomberg Tech's Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow at CES in Las Vegas to discuss the big box giant's push into AI. Plus, Oshkosh Corporation CEO John Pfeifer weighs in on President Trump's demand that defense companies stop buybacks and dividends, and also discusses Oshkosh's push into AI for its industrial machinery. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Set to Control All Venezuela Oil Exports | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 1/7/2026

description: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem defended federal ICE officers that shot and killed a woman during a confrontation in Minneapolis. Noem says a woman tried to run over the officers and they opened fire killing her. Jacob Frey, the democratic mayor of Minneapolis, says ICE officers are causing chaos and ripping families apart. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: DHS Defends Deadly Shooting by ICE Agents in Minneapolis

author: Ellen Milligan, Alex Wickham
description: British support for the US operation to seize a Russian-flagged oil tanker demonstrated the importance of the transatlantic security partnership, UK Defence Secretary John Healey said, even as tensions rise over President Donald Trump’s designs on Greenland.
title: UK Sees Tanker Seizure as Show of Europe’s Role in US Security

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer appeared to be acting in self defense in a shooting that killed a woman in Minneapolis on Wednesday.
title: Trump Defends ICE Officer in Fatal Minneapolis Shooting

author: Aashna Shah
description: Maryland has suffered the steepest contraction in federal employment of any US state, losing nearly 25,000 government workers since last January, according to figures released Wednesday by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
title: Maryland Federal Payrolls Shrink by 25,000 Since Last January

description: Daniel Danker, Walmart EVP of AI Acceleration, Product and Design sits down with Ed Ludlow and Caroline Hyde at CES in Las Vegas to discuss the AI technology that Walmart is developing to increase efficiency in stores and warehouses. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Walmart to Harness AI For Edge in Big Box Competition

author: Andreina Itriago, Fabiola Zerpa
description: The Trump administration is quickly moving to reestablish a diplomatic presence in Venezuela, asking local staff to prepare for the arrival of US officials at its embassy in Caracas as soon as this week.
title: US Pushes Ahead With Plans to Reopen Embassy in Venezuela

description: Bloomberg's Joe Deaux says that the United States' control of Venezuela's oil in the wake of the capture of Nicolas Maduro is 'uncharted territory' and that it is not clear what the long term plan is for selling the country's oil and how the two governments will divide the profits.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Energy Secretary Wright Says US Will Control Venezuela Oil Exports 'Indefinitely'

description: Oshkosh Corporation CEO John Pfeifer speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec about AI-driven autonomous industrial machinery and the future for Oshkosh. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Oshkosh Corp Unveils AI-Driven Industrial Machinery

description: On today's show, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino, Republican Congressman Bryan Steil of Wisconsin and former Republican Congressman Patrick McHenry. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Targets Big Home Investors | Balance of Power: Early Edition 1/07/2026

description: Cleveland State University's Chaired Professor Milena Sterio discusses the debates among experts about the legality of seizing ships in international waters. Sterio also talks about the capture of Venezuela's Maduro and called the action "blatantly illegal". She joined the conversation on "Bloomberg Markets" with Scarlet Fu. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Law Professor Discusses Legality of US Ship Seizure In Atlantic

description: Wayne Sanders, senior defense research analyst for Bloomberg Intelligence, breaks down what happens when the US military seizes an oil tanker and the potential geopolitical calculus involved as the US targets a ship escorted by a Russian submarine. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Seizes More Tankers, Keeps Pressure On after Maduro Capture

description: President Donald Trump said he wouldn’t allow defense companies to issue dividends or buy back their own stock until they invest more in production and research, comments that triggered a selloff across the sector. Stocks for contractors took a hit during the session on Wednesday.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Won't Let Defense Companies Issue Dividends and Buy Back Stock

description: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer fatally shot a woman during a confrontation in Minneapolis, sparking anger from local officials over the presence of ICE agents in the city. It happened during an illegal immigration crackdown. The Department of Homeland Security says the woman drove her vehicle toward officers and they responded. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: ICE Agent Kills Woman in Confrontation in Minneapolis

description: Cliff Young, chair of public affairs at Ipsos, says that Americans are concerned that action in Venezuela will lead the US down the path to another forever war, with only a third of Americans telling the polling outfit that they support the removal of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro. Support is also split by political part — 65% of Republicans backing the action, compared to only 11% of Democrats (Source: Bloomberg)
title: New Poll Shows Only a Third of Americans Support Maduro's Removal

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: President Donald Trump said he wouldn’t allow defense companies to issue dividends or buy back their own stock until they invest more in production and research, comments that triggered a selloff across the sector.
title: Trump Demands Defense Companies Stop Buybacks and Dividends

description:
"Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests: Cleveland State University College of Law Chaired Professor Milena Sterio, Infineon Technologies CEO Jochen Hanebeck, Bloomberg's Wayne Sanders, Julian Lee, Bailey Lipschultz, Kenneth Shea and Annabelle Droulers.
 (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Seizes Two 'Dark Fleet' Tanker, Discord Said to File For IPO | Bloomberg Markets 1/7/2026

description: Republican Representative Bryan Steil of Wisconsin said it's imperative to make homeownership more accessible by bringing down interest rates and increasing housing supply and he's waiting to see more details of the president's plan to block institutional investors from buying single-family homes.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump to Push Congress to Ban Institutional Purchases of Single-Family Homes

author: Anna J Kaiser
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis called for the state to pursue congressional redistricting through a special legislative session, officially joining the race between red and blue states to redraw maps ahead of the 2026 midterm elections.
title: DeSantis Calls for Florida Redistricting Session in April

author: Myles Miller, Alicia A. Caldwell
description: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer fatally shot a woman during a confrontation in Minneapolis, sparking anger over the presence of ICE agents in the city.
title: ICE Agent Kills Woman During Minneapolis Immigration Action

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Katy O'Donnell
description: President Donald Trump said he would move to ban institutional investors from buying single-family homes as part of a push to address housing affordability.
title: Trump Targets Institutional Purchases of Single-Family Homes

author: Steven T. Dennis, Erik Wasson
description: Congressional Republicans said they don’t expect US personnel to be deployed in Venezuela after the arrest and ouster of President Nicolas Maduro, following a briefing by administration officials.
title: GOP Lawmakers Expect No US Troops in Venezuela, Greenland

description: On today’s Big Take Asia Podcast, Bloomberg’s Jenni Marsh and host K. Oanh Ha talk through what the intervention means for China’s strategic ties and oil supplies and how the military strike could change Beijing’s stance toward Taiwan. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: How Venezuela Shifts China's Calculus

description: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — Authorities reported a shooting Wednesday involving federal agents in Minneapolis, where immigration enforcement has been conducting a major crackdown.
title: Federal Agents Involved in Minneapolis Shooting, Authorities Say

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: The surprise US attack and capture of Nicolás Maduro could reshape energy markets and America’s approach to economic statecraft.
title: Trump’s Venezuela Gambit Makes Oil a Tool of American Power

description: US forces seized two more sanctioned oil tankers, the M/V Bella 1 and the M/T Sophia, as part of its energy quarantine of Venezuela. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi says the ships were part of Russia's "ghost fleet." US officials say the ships were boarded after conducting illicit activities. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Seizes Two Oil Tankers as Part of Venezuela Blockade

author: Joe Mayes
description: New workers’ rights legislation in the UK is expected to cost businesses £1 billion ($1.3 billion) each year, with those in hospitality and retail hit hardest, according to an official government analysis.
title: UK Workers’ Rights Package to Cost Firms £1 Billion Annually

description: Ray Dalio explains why tariffs are “not bad,” arguing that they have historically been a major source of government revenue and can play a role in today’s changing global order. He's on this week's episode of The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations. This interview was recorded June 26 at the 92nd Street Y in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Ray Dalio Says Tariffs Are 'Not Bad'

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: US President Donald Trump leveled fresh criticism toward NATO, days after Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said his desired takeover of her nation’s territory of Greenland would mean the end of the military alliance.
title: Trump Airs Doubts on NATO Usefulness as Greenland Tensions Rise

author: Emily Nicolle
description: President Donald Trump has revived his long-running ambition to bring Greenland under US control, but traders putting money on the outcome are skeptical it will happen this year, while assigning higher odds to some form of acquisition before his term ends.
title: Trump’s Greenland Bid Faces Long Odds in Prediction Markets

description: President Donald Trump has the attention of corporate America and CEOs, says David Rubenstein. Trump says he will be meeting with insurance company and oil industry leaders soon. Rubenstein is on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: CEOs Are Paying Attention to Trump, Rubenstein Says

description: American military forces have seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker that is linked to Venezuela. The ship is not carrying any oil. It was chased across the ocean and boarded in the north Atlantic. Bloomberg's Simon Casey reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Seizes Russian-Flagged Oil Tanker Linked to Venezuela

author: Fabiola Zerpa
description: Acting Venezuela leader Delcy Rodríguez tapped an official who is under US sanctions to head the presidential security corps and military intelligence police, her first major security move since Nicolás Maduro’s capture.
title: Venezuela’s Rodríguez Names US-Sanctioned General as Intel Chief

author: Ari Natter, Naureen S Malik
description: The Trump Administration plans to control future sales of oil from Venezuela and use the proceeds to rebuild the nation’s beleaguered economy, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said
title: US Will Control Venezuela Oil Sales, Trump’s Energy Boss Says

author: Jan Bratanic
description: Slovenia’s president nominated Primoz Dolenc to lead the central bank, a last-ditch attempt to break political stalemate over the country’s top monetary-policy job before elections.
title: Slovenian President Proposes Dolenc as Central Bank Governor

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney will make an official visit to China next week as his government tries to rebuild relations with the Asian superpower and reduce Canada’s economic reliance on the US.
title: Carney to Visit China to Talk Trade With Xi as US Tariffs Hit Growth

author: Sara Sjolin, Francine Lacqua
description: Denmark is banking on a proposed high-level meeting in Washington to defuse President Donald Trump’s renewed push on Greenland and reset strained ties with the US over the strategic Arctic territory.
title: Denmark Pins Hopes on Proposed Rubio Talk to Ease Greenland Spat

author: Nectar Gan, Erica Yokoyama
description: China is testing Donald Trump’s support for America’s top ally in Asia by imposing export controls on Japan months after the US leader boasted he’d settled the rare earth issue “for the world.”
title: Xi Is Testing Japan’s Ties With Trump by Escalating Trade Battle

description: President Donald Trump said Venezuela would relinquish as much as 50 million barrels of oil to the US, worth roughly $2.8 billion at the current market price, announcing the cargoes would be sold with proceeds benefiting both countries. the announcement late on Tuesday, which came with few details, marked a significant step up for the US government as it seeks to extend its economic influence in Venezuela and beyond after the capture of leader Nicolas Maduro over the weekend. It's also a blow to China, previously the top buyer of the country's oil and a close partner.  Our EMEA news director Will Kennedy joined Stephen Carroll and Valerie Tytel on Bloomberg Radio with the details. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Says Venezuela to Send US Oil Worth Up to $2.8 Billion

author: Arsalan Shahla, Eltaf Najafizada
description: Iran’s president ordered security forces not to target peaceful protesters, a bid to defuse violent unrest that activists say has left at least 36 people dead.
title: Iran’s President Tells Security Forces Not to Target Protesters

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his team will move on to discuss the “most difficult issues” with Donald Trump’s envoys after negotiators secured a breakthrough on security guarantees for Kyiv.
title: Ukraine to Tackle ‘Most Difficult Issues’ as US Talks Advance

author: Lucy White
description: Reform UK said former prosecutor Laila Cunningham will be its candidate for London Mayor at the next vote in 2028, as Nigel Farage’s populist outfit seeks to build support in the British capital.
title: Reform UK Names Former Prosecutor as Candidate for London Mayor

author: Jim Wyss
description: Cubans are on high alert and the streets are under heavy guard, bracing for what comes next as officials mourned the 32 members of its security services killed in the US operation to arrest Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
title: Cubans ‘Scared and Nervous’ After US Attack on Venezuela Destroys Morale

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Demonstrations sparked by plunge in Islamic Republic’s currency continue amid the threat of US intervention.
title: Iran’s Protest-Crackdown Playbook Tests Limits

author: Weilun Soon, Serene Cheong
description: A vessel bearing the hallmarks of US forces appears to be closing in on a Venezuela-linked, Russia-flagged ship pursued since Washington began a full oil blockade last month, according to satellite images and maritime experts.
title: Ship Closes In on Russia-Flagged Tanker Pursued by US Forces

description: Former French Prime Minister Dominique de Villepin said Europe should not accept any threat to the sovereignty of Greenland by the United States, that would be a red line. De Villepin, who grew up in Caracas, also said the capture of Nicolas Maduro in Venezuela risks encouraging nuclear proliferation and damage the US soft power even further. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: France’s de Villepin: US Attack on Greenland a Red Line

description: Lars-Christian Brask, Danish Parliament deputy speaker, discusses US President Donald Trump's recent comments about acquiring Greenland as a national security priority. "One NATO country doesn't go and require territory of another NATO country," Brask tells Bloomberg Television. "It's unheard of and it's disrespectful," he adds. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Request for Greenland Is 'Disrespectful,' Denmark Says

author: Samy Adghirni, Francine Lacqua
description: Former French Prime Minister Dominique de Villepin said any attack by the US on Greenland would be a red line for Europe after the White House said President Donald Trump wouldn’t rule out the use of military force to take the semi-autonomous Danish territory.
title: Former French Premier Says US Attack on Greenland a Red Line

author: Fares Alghoul
description: It’s hemmed in by Israel’s tanks and troops. US President Donald Trump has threatened it with annihilation. But Hamas, defiant in the ruins of less than half of Gaza, is clawing its way back to a semblance of pre-war governance.
title: With Rifles and Defiance, Hamas Clings to Remnants of Gaza Rule

author: John Liu, Fran Wang
description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro may have done more to hollow out China’s presence in his economy than Donald Trump ever could.
title: Maduro’s ‘Perfect Union’ With China Hides Deep Economic Rupture

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, the White House says Donald Trump will not rule out using military force to take control of Greenland, standing firm that acquiring the island is a national security priority. 

Brent fell after Donald Trump said Venezuela will send up to 50 million barrels of oil to the US. That’s worth roughly $2.8 billion at the current market prices and represents about 50 days of Venezuelan oil production.

Today's guests: University of Essex Government Professor, Natasha Lindstaedt & Aneeka Gupta, Director of Macroeconomics Research at WisdomTree. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Greenland Force Not Ruled Out, Venezuela To Send US Oil | Daybreak Europe 1/7/2026

author: Michal Kubala
description: Prime Minister Andrej Babis said the Czech-led effort to supply Ukraine with ammunition may continue, shifting away from his earlier critical stance of the project.
title: Czech Premier Signals Ammunition Program for Ukraine Will Go On

author: Dan Murtaugh
description: China launched an anti-dumping probe into imports from Japan of dichlorosilane, a material used in the chipmaking process, the Ministry of Commerce said in a statement.
title: China Starts Anti-Dumping Probe Into Japan Chipmaking Material

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels are creating an autonomously governed region in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo despite ongoing efforts by the US and Qatar to get the group to withdraw, United Nations experts said.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Seek Autonomous Congo Zone, UN Experts Say

description: President Donald Trump said Venezuela would relinquish as much as 50 million barrels of oil to the US, worth roughly $2.8 billion at the current market price. The volumes cited by Trump would represent about 30 to 50 days of Venezuelan oil production before the US’s partial blockade of the country. The announcement comes as a blow to China, previously the top buyer of Venezuela’s oil and a close partner. Bloomberg’s Stephen Stapczynski reports.
title: Trump: Venezuela to Send Oil Worth Up to $2.8 Bln to US

description: President Donald Trump’s administration and Ukraine’s European allies converged toward an agreement to offer security guarantees long sought by Kyiv during a meeting in Paris. US special envoy Steve Witkoff said officials made significant progress on a plan to end Russia’s war and “largely finished the security protocols.” He vowed that the US-backed protocols would “deter” and “defend” Ukraine from future attacks. Bloomberg’s Greg Sullivan reports.
title: US, Europe Make Progress on Ukraine Security Protocols

description: The White House said President Donald Trump won’t rule out the use of military force to acquire Greenland. Secretary of State Marco Rubio downplayed the notion of military action on Monday, signaling that an invasion was not imminent and that the goal was to buy the island from Denmark, according to the Wall Street Journal. Bloomberg’s Rosalind Mathieson reports.
title: US Won’t Rule Out Use of Military to Acquire Greenland

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said the country’s relations with Japan are as important as those with China, seeking to balance his country’s foreign interests at a time when Beijing is courting Seoul while turning up pressure on Tokyo over a lingering diplomatic dispute.
title: South Korea’s Lee Sees Japan Ties as Vital as China Relations

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: Russia targeted South African video gamers as part of a recruitment drive for its war in Ukraine, according to documents involving two men who left to fight.
title: Russia Recruited South Africans for Its War Using a Gaming App

description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Iran faces a new round of protests challenging the country's theocracy, but it seems like the only thing people there want to talk about is half a world away: Venezuela.
title: Protest-Hit Iran Warily Watches the US After Venezuela Raid

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: US President Donald Trump said Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was unhappy with him due to Washington’s high tariffs on the South Asian nation, the latest sign of continued strain between the two countries.
title: Trump Says Modi Unhappy Over Tariffs as India Cuts Russian Oil

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: China blacklisted two Taiwanese ministers for supporting independence and pledged unspecified punishments — the first time it has targeted officials in Taipei since Lai Ching-te became president.
title: China Blacklists Two Taiwan Ministers for Backing Independence

author: Dan Murtaugh
description: Orsted A/S filed a legal challenge to the Trump administration’s order to halt construction of its offshore wind project near New York.
title: Orsted’s NY Wind Project Challenges US Suspension of Lease

author: Koh Yoshida, Tsuyoshi Inajima, Yuki Furukawa
description: China’s ban on exports of products with potential military use to Japan marks an escalation in the diplomatic spat between the countries that could disrupt global supply chains for high-tech components.
title: Japanese Manufacturers Face Fresh Threat on Chinese Export Curbs

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump’s administration has told Venezuela’s interim leader, Delcy Rodriguez, that her government must exclusively partner with the US on oil production and favor the US when selling heavy crude, ABC reported.
title: US Tells Venezuela to Cut Ties With China and Russia, ABC Says

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Chris Deluzio (D-PA) talks about President Trump warning he'll be impeached if the GOP loses the midterm elections. Rufus Gifford, former US Ambassador to Denmark, shares Greenland's & Denmark's reaction to Trump's renewed calls to take over Greenland. Rep. Byron Donalds (R-FL) on next steps for Venezuela. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Warns He'll Be Impeached if GOP Loses Midterms | Balance of Power: Late Edition 01/06/2026

author: Patricia Laya
description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado said she believes the US has told acting President Delcy Rodríguez to take steps toward an eventual handover of power.
title: Machado Says US Told Venezuelan Leader to Move Toward Transition
